string-array.name: soil
string-array.item: • Always use appropriate fertilizer in right quantity based on soil test.
District Agriculture Officer / District Soil Conservation Officer
50percentage of the cost limited to Rs 100/- per hectare.

Alkaline/Saline Soil:50percentage of cost to a limit of Rs 25,000/- per hectare. and or Rs 50,000/- per beneficiary. Acidic Soil:50percentage of cost subject to a limit of Rs 3000/- per hectare. and/or Rs6000/- per beneficiaries.
National Mission of Oilseeds and Oil Palm (NMOOP)

string-array.name: seeds
string-array.item: • Always use recommended variety of seeds as per local climate and adopt recommended seed rate and spacing.\n • Replace seeds of wheat, paddy, barley, pulses (except arhar), oilseeds (except rapeseed, mustard and sunflower) once in three years, seeds of maize, bajra, jowar, arhar, rapeseed, mustard and sunflower once in
District Agriculture Officer / District Soil Conservation Officer
Rs 50/- per kg or 50percentage of cost whichever is less
HYV seeds of Paddy and Wheat
Rs 10/- per kg or 50percentage of the cost whichever is less
Assistance for boosting seed production in private sector including individual or entrepreneurs, self help groups etc.

Credit-linked back-ended capital subsidy at the rate of 40percentage of project cost in general areas and 50percentage in case of hill areas and scheduled areas subject to upper limit of Rs 150 lakhs per project.
Assistance for Production of Foundation and Certified Seeds
National Mission on Agricultural Extension and Technology (NMAET)

string-array.name: Irrigation
string-array.item:
• Conserve soil and water through good agricultural practices.
 • Harvest rain water through construction of check dams and ponds.
 • Adopt crop diversification , seed production and nursery raising in water logged areas.
 • Adopt drip and sprinkler irrigation system to save 30-37percentage water and enhance crop quality and productivity
District Agriculture Officer / District Soil Conservation Officer
Construction of new Farm Ponds with lining to reduce the percolation losses
Rs 40,000/- per pond of 20m x 20m x 3m for construction and Rs 40,000/- for lining purpose
National Mission of Oilseeds and Oil Palm (NMOOP)(NFSM)
Water lifting Devices (Electric, Diesel, Wind/ Solar)
50percentage of the cost of installation limited to Rs 15,000/- per electric/diesel unit andRs 50,000/- per solar/wind unit.

25-35percentage of the total cost of installation in nonDPAP/DD regions and 35-50percnetage in DPAP/DDP region Additional 10percentage assistanceto be provided by State Govt. (DPAP-Drought Prone Area Programme, DDP-Desert Development Programme, NEandH states – North Eastern and Himalayan States) Upper limit of assistance will be restricted to the amount as per the eligible pattern of assistance of the normative cost of installation. Normative cost of installation for wide spaced crops Rs 37,200/ha (average) and for close spaced crops Rs 90,000/ha (average). However, the cost will vary depending on crop spacing and land size. Maximum permissible assistance will be restricted to 5 ha per beneficiary/group

string-array.name: Training
string-array.item: • 25,000 functionaries dedicated for agricultural extension are being provided at the Block level and below, under the
District Agriculture Officer / District Soil Conservation Officer
Training on Repair, Maintenance, Operation and selection of various Agricultural Machinery and Equipments and Post Harvest Management
Assistance for training on seed production and seed technology for a group of 50 to 150 farmers

Rs 15,000/- per training (for 3 one-day training programmes): (i)At the time of sowing of seed crop: training on seed production technique, isolation distance, sowing practices and other agronomic practices.(ii)At the time of flower initiation stage of the crop.(iii)After harvest and at the time of seed processin
Training and Extension for Farmers under National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture (NMSA)
Training and Demonstration on Soil Health
Training to farmers including field demonstrations; Rs 10,000/-per training session for 20 participants or more.Rs 20,000/- per Front Line Field Demonstration
Training and Extension for Farmers under National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture (NMSA)

string-array.name: Credit
string-array.item:
• To save themselves from the clutches of money lenders, farmers can avail loan facility from banks.
 • Loan facility is available through large network of Commercial Banks, Regional Rural Banks and Cooperative Credit Institutions in the country to fulfill the crop loan and term loan needs of the farmers.
 • Ensure timely repayment of bank loan.
Nearest Commercial Banks, Regional Rural Banks and Cooperative Credit Societies

Farmers can avail crop loan through Kisan Credit Card. Loan or credit limit is fixed on the basis of crop sown and area under cultivation. Kisan Credit Cards are valid for 3 to 5 years. Farmers are also provided risk coverage in the event of accidental death or disability. Crop coverage loans are covered under the Crop Insurance Scheme.
Loan facility to the farmers is available for investment purposes in the areas viz. Irrigation, Agricultural Mechanization, Land Development, Plantation, Horticulture and Post-Harvest Management

Crop loan upto Rs 3 lakhs at 7percentage rate of interest. This interest rate becomes 4percentage due to 3percentage interest subvention incentives provided to those farmers who repay crop loan on time

string-array.name: Insurance
string-array.item:
• Safeguard yourself financially against non-preventable natural risks like natural disasters/calamity, insect, pests and diseases, and adverse weather conditions.
 • Insurance coverage under NAIS/MNAIS/WBCIS is compulsorily, if you avail crop loan for notified crops.
 Coverage is voluntary for non-loanee farmers.
 Contact nearest branch of bank/insurance company for availing the benefits under the Crop Insurance Scheme.
Nearest branch of Bank/Empanelled General Insurance Companies, Credit and Cooperative Society and District Agriculture Officer/

• Insurance protection for Coconut Palm growers.
 • Premium rate per palm ranges from 9.00 (in the age group of 4 to 15 years) to 14.00 (in the age group of 16 to 60 years).
 • 50-75percentage subsidy of premium is provided to all types of farmers.
 • When the Palm trees are damaged, the indemnity payment equal to sum insured/ damage is payable to the insured farmers in notified areas.

• Insurance protection for notified food crops, oilseeds and annual horticultural/commercial crops. • Actuarial Premium rate for notified crops subject to maximum premium upto 11percentage and 9percentage for food and oilseeds crops of Kharif and Rabi seasons, respectively. For annual commercial/horticultural crops, it is capped at 13percentage. • Subsidy upto 75percentage of premium is provided to all types of farmers depending on the slab of premium. a.Upto 2percentage to Nil, b. More than 2 to 5percentage : 40percentage subject to minimum net premium of 2percentage, c. More than 5 – 10percentage:50percentage subject to minimum net premium of 3percentage, d.More than 10 – 15percentage : 60percentage subject to minimum net premium of 5percentage, e.More than 15percentage : 75percentage subject to minimum net premiumof 6 percentage • If the sowing is not done due to adverse weather/climate, claims/indemnity upto 25percentage of sum insured will be paid for prevented sowing/planting risk. • When the crop yield is less than the gu aranteed yield of notified crops, the indemnity payment equal to shortfall in yield is payable to all insured farmers in the notified areas. • However, on-account advance payment, up to 25percentage of likely claims will be paid as immediate relief in those notified areas where yield losses are atleast 50percentage of Threshold Yield (TY). Besides, post harvest (upto 2 weeks) losses due to cyclone are also covered. Losses due to localized risks of hailstorm and landslide are assessed on individual basis and claims to affected insured farmers are paid accordingly.

• Insurance protection for notified food crops, oilseeds and horticultural/commercial crops • Actuarial Premium rate for notified crops, subject to maximum premium upto 10percentage and 8percentage for food and oilseeds crops of Kharif and Rabi seasons, respectively and 12percentage for annual commercial/horticultural crops. It is capped at 12percentage. a.Upto2percentage to Nil subsidy, b.More than 2 to 5percentage - 25percentage subsidy subject to minimum net premium of 2percentage, c.More than 5 to 8 to 40percentage subsidy subject to minimum net premium of 3.75percentage, d.More than 8to50percentage subsidy subject to minimum net premium of 4.8percentage and maximum net premium of 6percentage payable by farmers. • When the Weather indices (rainfall/temperature/relative humidity/wind speed etc) differ (less/higher) from the Guaranteed Weather Index of notified crops, the indemnity payment equal to deviation/shortfall is payable to all insured farmers of notified crops in notified area.

string-array.name: Protection
string-array.item: • Bio-pesticides should be given priority over chemical pesticides.
District Agriculture Officer / District Soil Conservation Officer
Distribution of plant protection chemicals, bio-pesticides/IPM
50percentage of the cost or Rs 500/- per hectare whichever is less
Directorate of Plant Protection, Quarantine and Storage, Faridabad in Haryana, through its 31 Central IPM Centres, located across the country, organizes various programmes
Farmers Field School organized through various Central Integrated Pest Management Centres(CIPMC)
Directorate of Plant Protection, Quarantine and Storage, Faridabad in Haryana, through its 31 Central IPM Centres, located across the country, organizes various programmes
ATMA Scheme (NMAET), Sub schemes NHM/ HMNEH under MIDH
Farmers Field School organized through various Central Integrated Pest Management Centres(CIPMC)
Directorate of Plant Protection, Quarantine and Storage, Faridabad in Haryana, through its 31 Central IPM Centres, located across the country, organizes various programmes
ATMA Scheme (NMAET), Sub schemes NHM/ HMNEH under MIDH

string-array.name: Mechanization
string-array.item: • Procure appropriate machinery/ equipment as per land
District Agriculture Officer / District Soil Conservation Officer
Procurement subsidy for establishment Establishment of Farm Machinery Banks for of Custom Hiring Centre upto Rs. 60 lakhs under SMAM
Maximum Permissible Project Cost - Project based Rs 24 lakhs
Establishment of Farm Machinery Banks for Custom Hiring under SMAM
Financial Assistance for Farm Machinery Equipment under NFSM
Rs. 600/- per machine or 50percentage of the cost whichever is less for Rice Crop is admissible only
Financial Assistance for procurement of Agricultural Machinery and Equipment under NFSM
Financial Assistance for Farm Machinery Equipment under NFSM
Rs. 1500/- per machine or 50percentage of the cost whichever is less for Rice Crop is admissible only
Financial Assistance for procurement of Agricultural Machinery and Equipment under NFSM

string-array.name: Marketing
string-array.item:
• Farmer can get the price information of their produce available on Agmarknet website (www. agmarknet. nic. in) or through Kisan Call Centres or SMS.
 • Harvesting and threshing should be done at appropriate time.
 • Proper grading, packing and labeling should be done before sale for better prices.
 • Transport of produce at proper market/mandi for getting remunerative price.
District Agriculture Officer / District Soil Conservation Officer
For all other categories of beneficiaries other than Sc/St,Ne state, hilly area.
For Storage Infrastructure projects under Agricultural Marketing Infrastructure (AMI) sub scheme of ISAM Main grameen Bhandaran Yojana)
NE States, Sikkim, UTs of Andaman and Nicobar and Lakshadweep Islands and hilly*areas with altitude >1000 m from msl
For Storage Infrastructure projects under Agricultural Marketing Infrastructure (AMI) sub scheme of ISAM Main grameen Bhandaran Yojana)
In other Areas For Registered FPOs, Panchayats, Women, Scheduled Caste (SC)/Scheduled Tribe (ST) beneficiaries or their cooperatives (certfred by state gov.) Self-Help Groups
For Storage Infrastructure projects under Agricultural Marketing Infrastructure (AMI) sub scheme of ISAM Main grameen Bhandaran Yojana)

string-array.name: Farming
string-array.item: •• Promote crop / cropping system suitable to agro
District Agricultural Officer / District Horticulture Officer / Project Director (ATMA)
Cropping System (CS) with rice, wheat, coarse cereal/oil-seed/fibre/pulse based two crops.
50percentage of input cost limited to Rs 10,000/-per hectare with permissible assistance of maximum 2 hectare/beneficiary
Horticulture Based Farming System (Plantation + Crops/Cropping system)
50percentage of input cost limited to Rs 25,000/- per hectare with permissibleassistance of maximum 2 hectare/ beneficiary
CB Cows + Mixed farming + FodderBuffalo +Mixed farming +Fodder Cow/buffalo+dairy+fodder cow/buffalo + small ruminants

50percentage of input cost of cropping system including cost of animals with one year concentrated food limited to Rs 40,000/- per hectare (2 milch animals + 1 ha CS) with permissible assistance of maximum 2 ha/beneficiary.

string-array.name: Horticulture
string-array.item:
• Adopt horticultural crops for higher income from lesser area.
 • For healthy crop plant use high quality seedlings.
 • To keep fruits and vegetables fresh for longer period, use cold storage facility/cool houses. • Earn maximum profit by adopting correct method of harvesting, cleaning, grading, processing and packing.
 • Produce off-season vegetables in poly-house, low-tunnel.
District Agriculture Officer / District Soil Conservation Officer
Bee Keeping for pollination support for bee hives (Maximum 50 colonies / beneficiary)
Sub Schemes of NHM and HMNEH under MIDH
Flowers (Loose bulbous and cut flowers) (Maximum 2 hectares / beneficiary)
Rs.16,000/- per ha to Rs.60,000/- per ha
Sub Schemes of NHM and HMNEH under MIDH
Establishing of new fruits orchard with integration of drip etc (for a Maximum area of 4 ha per beneficiary)
Rs. 0.40 lakh per ha. to Rs. 2.20 lakh/ha.
Sub Schemes of NHM and HMNEH under MIDH

resources.string: Mahindra Bucket Scrapper is a Tractor mounted implement used for scrapping of uneven land and levelling it. This implement helps reduce soil erosion by levelling the land uniformly and also ensures uniform irrigation for the entire area.

Mahindra Cultivator is a secondary tillage equipment mounted on a tractor to till the agriculture land. The cultivator is available in different sizes for different HP range of tractor. It stirs and pulverizes the soil before planting .
Mahindra Disc Harrow is a tractor mounted implement attached on tow hook. Helps break the big clots of soil which emerge from the ploughing operations.
The Mahindra AppliTracs Disc Plough is a 3 point linkage primary land preparation implement. It is used for digging soil, generally more useful for soft soil condition.

Mahindra Potato planter is an ideal planting machine for small and big farms and suitable for minimum 45 HP tractors. An advance planting mechanism which ensures high planting speed with good accuracy and allows gentle handling of seed potatoes

Rice transplantation has a short sowing time frame available, it is critical to sow rice within this duration. Manual transplantation involves a lot of hardwork and consumes more time. Mechanisation in rice transplantation removes human drudgery and also helps sow rice faster. Mahindra AppliTracs Riding Type Rice Transplanter ensures precise transplantation by maintaining plant to plant distance and number of saplings per hill which helps better weeding and interculture and contributes to overall productivity.
Mahindra Seed drill is used for sowing of different type of seeds. The seed drill effectively sows seeds at equal distances and proper depth and helps avoid wastage.

Rice transplantation has a short sowing time frame available, it is critical to sow rice within this duration. Manual transplantation involves a lot of hardwork and consumes more time. Mechanisation in rice transplantation removes human drudgery and also helps sow rice faster. Mahindra AppliTracs Walk Behind Type Rice Transplanter ensures precise transplantation by maintaining plant to plant distance and number of saplings per hill which helps better weeding and interculture and contributes to overall productivity.
Mahindra Boom sprayer is connected to the three point linkage of tractor and is used for spraying on all kinds of crops to ensure crop protection.

Mahindra Fertilizer Spreader has been specially designed for spreading fertilizers in the field. This technology has been introduced for the first time in India. This machine is a three point linkage mounted implement and can be transported from one place to other.

Mahindra Back pack harvester is mounted on an existing tractor for harvesting of wheat, rice and other crops. It is suitable for small and marginal landholdings, helps increase utilisation of tractor and hence balance the economy of operations.

Connected with a three-point linkage mechanism and operated via the tractor’s powertrain, the Sickle Sword has a double-action cutter bar for swift, efficient cutting. It can be operated at variable speeds, and is easily detachable. Its unique floating mechanism follows the soil profile, and its robust construction and wear-resistant blade ensures equipment longevity.
Mahindra Mechanical Thresher offers speedy threshing operation for crops like wheat and rice in comparison to manual operations and helps reduce drudgery.

Mahindra Combine Harvester with tractor gives farmers the complete harvesting solution from cutting to threshing of crop. Tractor is mounted on harvester during harvesting time and acts as prime mover.

Mahindra Baler is used for post harvest application which allows handelling straw of harvested crop. Baler helps collect the straws and packs them into bundles so that it can be easily handled and transported.

Mahindra Mulcher is a Tractor mounted post harvest implement which helps clear remains of the harvested plants like cotton and banana. This single operation helps clear the field and prepare it for the next sowing season.
Mahindra Shredder Handles residual crop in field an important farm activity. Shredder chops the residual crop and mixes the same with soil, which becomes a natural compost for the next crop.
Backed by the well equipped infrastructural facilities and experienced personnel, our company has emerged as one of the well established manufacturers and exporters of Shrub Master.
Mahindra straw reaper performs 3 operations cut, thresh and clean straw in one pass. The Straw reaper when used with Mahindra tractors gives exceptional performance and consumes less fuel.
Mahindra Trolley primarily helps in transportation of agriculture produce. It is available in various sizes and can be attached with tractors of different HP type.
Mahindra vertical conveyer reaper offers speedy harvesting operation for crops like wheat, rice, soyabean in comparison to manual operations and helps reduce drugery.
